r:Description.r:Content: Usage: 'codeBook' is always the root element for a CDC xml document
Usage: ISO 3166 2-letter code for country should be used
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data
Usage: Title of the CDC XML document
Usage: Language of the study title. ISO 3166 2-letter code for country should be used
ElementRepeatable: Yes - to indicate study description pages in different languages
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data

Usage: Language of the study description page at the SP website (there can be multiple 'holding' elements for study description pages in different languages. ISO 3166 2-letter code for country should be used
Usage: This is the document the metadata refers to, i.e. the URL of the study description page at the SP website.
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data
Usage: Title of the Study. If additional titles are required in other languages, use the parTitl element
Usage: Language of the study title. ISO 3166 2-letter code for country should be used.

Usage: Title of the Study in additional languages other than the 'titl' element. It is preferable to include this element to hold an English version of the title if the 'titl' element is not in English.
Required: Mandatory if 'parTitl' element is present
Usage: Language of the translated study title. ISO 3166 2-letter code for country should be used.
Usage: Persistent identifier of the study
Required: Mandatory if 'IDNo' element is present
Usage: Language of the persistent identifier of the study
Usage: Agency responsible for the identifier of the study
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data
Usage: Principal investigator (Person reference) or Principal investigator (Institution reference)
Required: Mandatory if 'AuthEnty' element is present
Usage: Language of Person or Organisation Reference
Usage: If AuthEnty is a person, the organisational affiliation of that person
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data
Usage: The element should contain the name of the organisation who has published the metadata for the harvested study description. This is usually the SP.
Usage: Language of the organisation name
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data
Usage: The year or freetext date of when the study description was published
CDC UI Label: Year of publication
Required: Mandatory if 'distDate' element is present
Usage: Ideally 'YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ' format, but can accept 'YYYY-MM-DD', 'YYYY-MM' or 'YYYY' as date format.
CDC UI Label: Year of publication
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data
Usage: Subject classifcation term for the study
Required: Mandatory if 'topcClas' element is present
Usage: Language of the subject classification term

Usage: name of the vocabulary. CMM model says that it is mandatory to use CESSDA topsclas CV but for now all topClas terms will be harvested, regardless of vocabulary used. Put the string "CESSDA Topic Classification" into the @vocab Attribute for the terms where this voc is used, regardless of language.
Usage: This should contain the URN of the specific term change this year and CESSDA does not have URNS yet.
Usage: The unique machine-actionable identifier (e.g. "1") of the term that remains the same across languages
Usage: Subject classifcation term for the study
Required: Mandatory if 'keyword' element is present
Usage: Source of keywords - always ELSST
Usage: Not implemented yet until ELSST has a more stable URI scheme
Usage: Not implemented yet until ELSST has a more stable URI scheme
Required: Mandatory if 'keyword' element is present
Usage: The abstract for the study
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data
Usage: This is the free text expression of the collection period.
CDC UI Label: Data collection period
Required: Mandatory if collDate element is present
Usage: Language of the free text expression of the collection period
Required: Mandatory if @date Attribute is present
Usage: Either 'start', 'end' or 'single' to indicate the type of @date Attribute
CDC UI Label: Data collection period: start date OR Data collection period: End date
Required: Mandatory if 'collDate' element is present
Usage: Ideally YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ format , but can accept YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-MM or YYYY as date attribute. If there are multiple end dates, use the last.
Usage: Countries relevant to the study area
Required: Mandatory if 'nation' element is present
Usage: Language of the country label
Usage: ISO 3166 2-letter code for country should be used
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data
Usage: Language of the unit of analysis label (in the 'content' element)

Usage: If you use the CMM recommended DDI vocabulary, for @vocab use the string "DDI Analysis Unit" regardless of language. 'concept' contains the value of the code (=term ID) that is the same across languages, and 'anlyUnit' the term in local language. Use the URN of the source language CV version for vocabURI."
Usage: Use the URN of the source language CV version
Usage: the value of the code (=term ID) that is the same across languages
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data
Usage: Free text description of time dimension
Required: Mandatory if 'timeMeth' element is present
Usage: Language of the time dimension label

Usage: Time dimension CV item. If you use the CMM recommended DDI vocabulary, for @vocab use the string "DDI Time Method", regardless of language. 'concept' contains the value of the code (ID attribute) that is the same across languages, and 'timeMeth' is the term in local language. Use the canonical URI for the vocabURI "urn:ddi-cv:TimeMethod", if you enter URI, though this may change.
Usage: Name of the vocabulary used for Time Dimension
Usage: URI for the 'Time Dimension' Vocabulary
Usage: Term ID of the Time Dimension CV Item
Usage: Free text description of sampling procedure
Required: Mandatory if 'sampProc' element is present
Usage: Language of the sampling procedure description

Usage: 'Type of Sampling Procedure' CV item. If you use the CMM recommended DDI vocabulary, for @vocab use the string "DDI Sampling Procedure", regardless of language. 'concept' contains the value of the code (ID attribute) that is the same across languages, and 'sampProc' is the freetext description.
CDC UI Label: Type of sampling procedure
Usage: Name of the vocabulary used for Type Of Sampling Procedure
Usage: URI 'for the Type Of Sampling Procedure' Vocabulary
Usage: Term ID of the 'Type Of Sampling Procedure' CV Item
Usage: Free text description of data collection method
Required: Mandatory if 'collMode' element is present
Usage: Language of the Data collection method description

Usage: 'Mode Of Collection' CV item. If you use the CMM recommended DDI vocabulary, for @vocab use the string "DDI Mode Of Collection", regardless of language. 'concept' contains the value of the code (ID attribute) that is the same across languages, and 'collMode' is the freetext description.
CDC UI Label: Data collection method
Usage: Name of the vocabulary used for Data Collection Mode
Usage: URI for the 'Data Collection Mode' Vocabulary
Usage: Term ID of the 'Data Collection Mode' CV Item
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data

Usage: Refers to any information relating to the access and use conditions of data that the SP wants to send. SPs need to concatenate the information for 'restrctn' the way they want it to appear in the CDC, if they use data from different elements e.g.specPerm, restrctn, avlStatus etc.
CDC UI Label: Terms of data access
Usage: Language of the Access statement
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data
Usage: Structural element only - contains no data
Required: Mandatory if 'fileTxt' element is present
Required: Mandatory if 'fileName' element is present

Usage: Language(s) of data files. The only information necessary for CDC is the language of the files, as this is needed for the filter. The values or content of the 'fileTxt' or 'fileName' are not extracted.
CDC UI Label: Language of data file(s).
